When using Charging Hurler against a target within 30 feet, you can spend up to 2 stamina points. When you do, the bonus on your damage roll for that attack increases by double the number of stamina points you spent.
Improved Charging Hurler.shortDescription: Your target may be at any range

Improved Cleaving Finish.prereqs: Str 13, Cleave, Cleaving Finish, Great Cleave, Power Attack, base attack bonus +6
Improved Cleaving Finish.shortDescription: May use Cleaving Finish any number of times/round

Improved Collector's Boon.shortDescription: Greater a greater benefit when wearing an equipment set

Improved Conceal Spell.prereqs: Conceal Spell, Deceitful, Bluff 5 ranks, Disguise 5 ranks, Sleight of Hand 10 ranks, ability to cast 3rd-level spells or use a 3rd-level spell-like ability
description: Improved Conceal Spell
Source ~`Ultimate Intrigue pg. 84`~
You can conceal the mightiest spells in the subtlest fashions.
***Prerequisites:*** ~`Conceal Spell`~, ~`Deceitful`~, Bluff 5 ranks, Disguise 5 ranks, Sleight of Hand 10 ranks, ability to cast 3rd-level spells or use a 3rd-level spell-like ability.
***Benefit:*** When you use Conceal Spell, creatures no longer gain a bonus equal to the level of the spell or spell-like ability on their checks to notice the hidden spell.

***Normal:*** Creatures attempting to notice a spell hidden with Conceal Spell gain a bonus equal to the level of the spell or spell-like ability on their Perception, Sense Motive, and Spellcraft checks.

Improved Counterspell.shortDescription: Counterspell with spell of the same school

Improved Critical.prereqs: Proficiency with weapon, base attack bonus +8
description: Improved Critical (Combat)
Source ~`PRPG Core Rulebook pg. 127`~
Attacks made with your chosen weapon are quite deadly.
***Prerequisites:*** Proficient with weapon, base attack bonus +8.
***Benefit:*** When using the weapon you selected, your threat range is doubled.

***Special:*** You can gain Improved Critical multiple times. The effects do not stack. Each time you take the feat, it applies to a new type of weapon. This effect doesn't stack with any other effect that expands the threat range of a weapon.
~`Combat Trick`~ (from the ~`Combat Stamina`~ feat)
Source ~`Pathfinder Unchained pg. 123`~

When you hit with an attack and the roll fails to threaten a critical hit by 3 or less, you can spend 5 stamina points to attempt to deal double damage anyway. Roll as if confirming a critical hit. If this confirmation roll succeeds, your attack is still not a critical hit, but it deals double damage.
Mythic Improved Critical
Source ~`Mythic Adventures pg. 66`~
Your critical strikes with your chosen weapon are deadlier than most.
***Prerequisites:*** ~`Improved Critical`~, base attack bonus +8.
***Benefit:*** Your critical multiplier with your chosen weapon is increased by 1 (to a maximum of ??6).
***Special:*** You can gain this feat multiple times. The effects do not stack. Each time you take this feat, it applies to a different non-mythic Improved Critical feat.
Improved Critical.shortDescription: Double the threat range of one weapon

Improved Dark Sight.shortDescription: Gain the ability to see perfectly in darkness, at the cost of light blindness

Improved Day Job.prereqs: Ability to attempt Day Job checks (see the Guide to Pathfinder Society Organized Play)
description: Improved Day Job
Source ~`Pathfinder Society Primer pg. 8`~
You learned the importance of an honest day's work
while training as an initiate of the Pathfinder Society.
***Prerequisites:*** Ability to attempt Day Job checks (see
the Guide to Pathfinder Society Organized Play).
***Benefit:*** You gain a +3 bonus on Day Job checks using
one skill you choose when you take this feat. This bonus
stacks with other feats that grant a bonus to the chosen
skill, including Skill Focus.
Improved Day Job.shortDescription: +3 bonus on Day Job checks (in PFS Organized Play)

Improved Death-Stealing.shortDescription: Your undead spawn rise as more powerful creatures.

Improved Devastating Strike.prereqs: Devastating Strike, Vital Strike, base attack bonus +13
Improved Devastating Strike.shortDescription: Gain bonus on rolls to confirm critical hits

Improved Dirge of Doom.prereqs: Ability to perform dirge of doom
description: Improved Dirge of Doom
Source ~`Advanced Class Guide pg. 150`~
The foreboding tone of your dirge is especially effective at unsettling your enemies.
***Prerequisites:*** Ability to perform dirge of doom.

***Benefit:*** The range of your dirge of doom ability is extended to 60 feet. Additionally, if a creature is shaken from another effect, the effect of your dirge of doom is changed to frightened for that specific creature. This benefit cannot cause a creature to become panicked, even if a target is already frightened from another effect.

***Normal:*** The range of dirge of doom is 30 feet. A creature that is already shaken cannot become frightened by dirge of doom. Once affected by this feat, a creature cannot be affected by it again for 24 hours.
Improved Dirge of Doom.shortDescription: Dirge of doom expands to 60 feet and can cause fear up to frightened

Improved Dirty Trick.shortDescription: +2 bonus on dirty trick attempts, no attack of opportunity

Improved Disarm.shortDescription: +2 bonus on disarm attempts, no attack of opportunity

Improved Disarm Partner.shortDescription: Make attacks of opportunity and disarm checks when an ally fails to disarm someone

Improved Drag.prereqs: Str 13, Power Attack, base attack bonus +1
description: Improved Drag (Combat)
Source ~`Advanced Player's Guide pg. 162`~
You are skilled at dragging foes around the battlefield.
***Prerequisites:*** Str 13, ~`Power Attack`~, base attack bonus +1.

***Benefit:*** You do not provoke an attack of opportunity when performing a drag combat maneuver. In addition, you receive a +2 bonus on checks made to drag a foe. You also receive a +2 bonus to your Combat Maneuver Defense when an opponent tries to drag you.
***Normal:*** You provoke an attack of opportunity when performing a drag combat maneuver.
~`Combat Trick`~ (from the ~`Combat Stamina`~ feat)
Source ~`Pathfinder Unchained pg. 123`~

When you are the target of a drag combat maneuver, you can spend a number of stamina points up to your Strength or Dexterity bonus, whichever is greater. Your CMD against that drag attempt increases by that number.
Mythic Improved Drag
Source ~`Mythic Adventures pg. 67`~
You pull your enemies around the battlefield with great ease.
***Prerequisites:*** ~`Improved Drag.`~

***Benefit:*** You gain a bonus equal to half your tier on checks to attempt a drag combat maneuver, and to your CMD when an opponent attempts a drag combat maneuver against you. These bonuses stack with those granted by Improved Drag.
Furthermore, you can make an attack of opportunity against any creature that attempts a drag maneuver against you, unless it also has this feat.
Improved Drag.shortDescription: +2 bonus on drag attempts, no attack of opportunity

Improved Drow Nobility.prereqs: Cha 13, Drow Nobility, able to use drow spell-like abilities, drow
description: Improved Drow Nobility
Source ~`Advanced Race Guide pg. 105`~
Your magical heritage is more potent than that of your peers, as demonstrated by your superior spell-like abilities.
***Prerequisites:*** Cha 13, ~`Drow Nobility`~, able to use drow spell-like abilities, drow.

***Benefit:*** You may use your dancing lights, faerie fire, feather fall, and levitate spell-like abilities twice per day. Your darkness spell-like ability instead becomes deeper darkness, which you may use twice per day.
Improved Drow Nobility.shortDescription: Gain even more drow spell-like abilities

Improved Duck and Cover.shortDescription: When you use Duck and Cover, an ally with evasion or improved evasion takes some of the damage

Improved Elemental Counterspell.prereqs: Two basic blast wild talents from two different elements, expanded element class feature, kinetic blast class feature
Improved Elemental Counterspell.shortDescription: You can use your kinetic blast to counterspell any elemental spell

Improved Familiar.prereqs: Ability to acquire a familiar, see feat
description: Improved Familiar
Source ~`PRPG Core Rulebook pg. 127`~
This feat allows you to acquire a powerful familiar, but only when you could normally acquire a new familiar.
***Prerequisites:*** Ability to acquire a new familiar, compatible alignment, sufficiently high level (see below).

***Benefit:*** When choosing a familiar, the creatures listed below are also available to you. You may choose a familiar with an alignment up to one step away on each alignment axis (lawful through chaotic, good through evil).
You can find the full list of available Improved Familiars ~`here`~.

Improved familiars otherwise use the rules for regular familiars, with two exceptions: if the creature's type is something other than animal, its type does not change; and improved familiars do not gain the ability to speak with other creatures of their kind (although many of them already have the ability to communicate).
Mythic Improved Familiar
Source ~`Mythic Adventures pg. 67`~
Your familiar gains some of your incredible resiliency and insight.
***Prerequisites:*** ~`Improved Familiar.`~

***Benefit:*** For every 3 tiers you possess, your familiar gains a +2 bonus to an ability score of your choice. These bonuses stack. Your familiar adds your tier to its natural armor bonus and to its spell resistance (if it has spell resistance).
Improved Familiar Bond
Source ~`Familiar Folio pg. 18`~
Your familiar gains greater power.
***Prerequisites:*** ~`Familiar Bond`~, ~`Iron Will.`~

***Benefit:*** Your familiar gains all the normal abilities available to a familiar of a wizard with a level equal to your total Hit Dice. You also gain the special ability normally gained by a master of your type of familiar.

Improved Feint Partner.prereqs: Bluff 1 rank, Combat Reflexes, Feint Partner, base attack bonus +6
Improved Feint Partner.shortDescription: When ally successfully feints, you gain attack of opportunity against opponent

Improved Feinting Flurry.prereqs: Dex 17, flurry of blows class feature, Combat Expertise, Feinting Flurry, base attack bonus +6
Improved Feinting Flurry.shortDescription: Deny your opponent their Dex bonus when using Feinting Flurry.

Improved Fiendish Darkness.prereqs: Fiendish Darkness, darkness spell-like ability, caster level 3rd, tiefling
Improved Fiendish Darkness.shortDescription: +2 CL when casting darkness; use darkness as swift action with an evil spell.

Improved Fiendish Sorcery.shortDescription: Treat your Charisma as 2 higher with the Rakshasa or Shadow bloodlines.

Improved Flexible Wizardry.prereqs: Flexible Wizardry, Spell Mastery, wizard level 8th

Improved Forceful Charge.prereqs: Forceful Charge, Improved Bull Rush, Power Attack, animal companion
Improved Forceful Charge.shortDescription: Bull rush and potentially trip larger foes when it charges

Improved Fury of the Tainted.prereqs: Cha 13, Fury of the Tainted, base attack bonus +8, rage class feature, tiefling
Improved Fury of the Tainted.shortDescription: Gain SR 10+levels against good spells while raging.

description: Improved Gaseous Form
Source ~`Blood of the Night pg. 17`~
Your gaseous state is more potent than that of your peers.
***Prerequisites:*** Vampire.

***Benefit:*** As a standard action, you can assume gaseous form at will (caster level 5th), but can remain gaseous indefinitely and have a fly speed of 20 feet with perfect maneuverability. This is a supernatural ability.

If you already possess the gaseous form special quality, you can instead choose to augment your gaseous form in one of the following ways. These effects apply only to creatures that enter your space while you are in gaseous form.
Glitterdust (Su): Creatures must succeed at a Will save or be blinded and outlined in golden particles as though under the effects of ~`glitterdust`~.
Mind Fog (Su): Creatures must succeed at a Will save or take penalties as though under the effects of ~`mind fog`~. This effect lasts as long as a creature shares your space and for 2d6 rounds after.
***Special:*** You can gain this feat multiple times. Each time you take this feat, choose another swarm type.
Improved Gaseous Form.shortDescription: Increase the strength and mobility of your gaseous form

description: Improved Grapple (Combat)
Source ~`PRPG Core Rulebook pg. 127`~
You are skilled at grappling opponents.
***Prerequisites:*** Dex 13, ~`Improved Unarmed Strike.`~

***Benefit:*** You do not provoke an attack of opportunity when performing a grapple combat maneuver. In addition, you receive a +2 bonus on checks made to grapple a foe. You also receive a +2 bonus to your Combat Maneuver Defense whenever an opponent tries to grapple you.
***Normal:*** You provoke an attack of opportunity when performing a grapple combat maneuver.
~`Combat Trick`~ (from the ~`Combat Stamina`~ feat)
Source ~`Pathfinder Unchained pg. 123`~

When you are the target of a grapple combat maneuver to initiate or maintain a grapple, you can spend a number of stamina points up to your Strength or Dexterity bonus, whichever is greater. Your CMD against that grapple attempt increases by that number.
Mythic Improved Grapple
Source ~`Mythic Adventures pg. 67`~
Your wrestling moves are difficult to counter.
***Prerequisites:*** ~`Improved Grapple.`~
***Benefit:*** You gain a bonus equal to half your tier on checks to grapple, and to your CMD when an opponent tries to grapple you. These bonuses stack with those granted by Improved Grapple.
Furthermore, you can make an attack of opportunity against any creature that attempts to grapple you, unless it also has this feat.
Improved Grapple.shortDescription: +2 bonus on grapple attempts, no attack of opportunity

Improved Great Fortitude.shortDescription: Once per day, you may reroll a Fortitude save

Improved Hammer Throw.prereqs: Int 13, Combat Expertise, Hammer Throw, Improved Trip, Point-Blank Shot, Precise Shot, base attack bonus +6, dwarf
Improved Hammer Throw.shortDescription: Trip larger opponents from further away when using Hammer Throw

Improved Horse Whisperer.prereqs: Horse Whisperer, Handle Animal 5 ranks, Ride 5 ranks

Improved Hunter's Bond.prereqs: Hunter's bond (hunting companions) class feature, ranger level 9th
Improved Hunter's Bond.shortDescription: Grant your allies full favored enemy bouns

Improved Impaling Critical.prereqs: Impaling Critical, Critical Focus, Weapon Specialization with selected piercing melee weapon, base attack bonus +13
Improved Impaling Critical.shortDescription: Impaled opponent must succeed at a grapple maneuver to pull your weapon out

description: Improved Improvisation
Source ~`Advanced Race Guide pg. 77`~
You are masterful in your improvisation.
***Prerequisites:*** Int 13, ~`Fast Learner`~, ~`Improvisation`~, human.
***Benefit:*** Your nonproficiency penalty with weapons, armor, and shields is halved. In addition, the bonus on all skill checks for skills you have no ranks in increases to +4 instead of +2.
Improved Improvisation.shortDescription: Halve nonproficiency penalty, gain +4 bonus when using Improvisation instead of +2

Improved Infuse Weapon.shortDescription: Add additional magical qualities when you infuse weapons.

Improved Intercept Blow.prereqs: Intercept Blow, base attack bonus +6, animal companion
Improved Intercept Blow.shortDescription: Further reduce damage while using Intercept Blows

description: Improved Iron Will
Source ~`PRPG Core Rulebook pg. 127`~
Your clarity of thought allows you to resist mental attacks.
***Prerequisites:*** ~`Iron Will.`~
***Benefit:*** Once per day, you may reroll a Will save. You must decide to use this ability before the results are revealed. You must take the second roll, even if it is worse.
Improved Iron Will.shortDescription: Once per day, you may reroll a Will save

description: Improved Ki Throw (Combat)
Source ~`Advanced Player's Guide pg. 163`~
Your enemies are living weapons in your hands.
***Prerequisites:*** ~`Improved Bull Rush`~, Ki Throw.

***Benefit:*** When using the Ki Throw feat, you may throw your target into any square you threaten that is occupied by another creature. Make a bull rush combat maneuver check with a -4 penalty against the secondary target. If this check succeeds, the thrown creature lands prone in the secondary target's square, while the secondary target is pushed back and knocked prone in an adjacent square. If the check fails, the thrown creature lands prone in the nearest square you threaten adjacent to the secondary target.
If you throw a Large or larger creature into an area containing multiple secondary targets, you take an additional penalty of -4 on your combat maneuver check for each target after the first.
***Special:*** A monk may take this as a bonus feat at 14th level.
~`Combat Trick`~ (from the ~`Combat Stamina`~ feat)
Source ~`Pathfinder Unchained pg. 123`~

When using this feat to throw a target into another creature's space, you can spend up to 6 stamina points to reduce the penalty on the bull rush attempt against the secondary target by an amount equal to the number of stamina points you spent.
Improved Ki Throw.shortDescription: Throw opponent into occupied square as a bull rush

Improved Learn Ranger Trap.shortDescription: Learn a new ranger trap and the ability to use both Ex and Su versions of traps you know

Improved Legendary Influence.prereqs: Legendary Influence, lesser spirit power and propitiation class features
description: Improved Legendary Influence
Source ~`Ultimate Intrigue pg. 85`~
Each legend grants you more of its power in return for greater influence.
***Prerequisites:*** ~`Legendary Influence`~, lesser spirit power and propitiation class features.

***Benefit:*** For each spirit you can channel, choose a second feat other than an item creation feat. Whenever you allow a spirit to gain 1 point of influence over you to gain that spirit's associated feat via Legendary Influence, you can allow that spirit to gain 1 additional point of influence over you to gain the second feat.
Improved Legendary Influence.shortDescription: Gain two different feats from each legend

Improved Lightning Reflexes.shortDescription: Once per day, you may reroll a Reflex save

Improved Lookout.shortDescription: Stop being flat-footed earlier when near another ally with Lookout who acts

Improved Low Blow.prereqs: Base attack bonus +4, halfling, low-blow racial trait
Improved Low Blow.shortDescription: +2 critical confirmation against larger opponents, 1/day reroll a confirmation roll

Improved Monster Lore.shortDescription: Gain a sacred bonus on monster lore checks

Improved Mounted Archery.prereqs: Mounted Archery, Mounted Combat, Ride 1 rank

description: Improved Natural Armor (Monster)
Source ~`Pathfinder RPG Bestiary pg. 315`~
This creature's hide is tougher than most.
***Prerequisites:*** Natural armor, Con 13.
***Benefit:*** The creature's natural armor bonus increases by +1.
***Special:*** A creature can gain this feat multiple times. Each time the creature takes the feat, its natural armor bonus increases by another point.
Improved Natural Attack (Monster)
Source ~`Pathfinder RPG Bestiary pg. 315`~
Attacks made by one of this creature's natural attacks leave vicious wounds.
***Prerequisites:*** Natural weapon, base attack bonus +4.

***Benefit:*** Choose one of the creature's natural attack forms (not an unarmed strike). The damage for this natural attack increases by one step on the following list, as if the creature's size had increased by one category. Damage dice increase as follows: 1d2, 1d3, 1d4, 1d6, 1d8, 2d6, 3d6, 4d6, 6d6, 8d6, 12d6.
A weapon or attack that deals 1d10 points of damage increases as follows: 1d10, 2d8, 3d8, 4d8, 6d8, 8d8, 12d8.
***Special:*** This feat can be taken multiple times. Each time it is taken, it applies to a different natural attack.
Improved Natural Attack.shortDescription: Increase the damage dice for one of your natural attacks.

Improved Natural Poison Harvester.prereqs: Natural Poison Harvester, Craft (alchemy) 9 ranks, Survival 9 ranks
Improved Natural Poison Harvester.shortDescription: Gain 1d4 additional doses when you harvest poison

Improved Outflank.shortDescription: Flank foe without having to be on opposite sides

Improved Overrun.shortDescription: +2 bonus on overrun attempts, no attack of opportunity

description: Improved Parry (Combat)
Source ~`People of the River pg. 12`~
A flick of the wrist binds your opponent's weapon.
***Prerequisites:*** Int 13, ~`Combat Expertise.`~

***Benefit:*** When you successfully parry a foe's melee attack (with a dueling parry or the parry class feature), your next melee attack against the target does not allow the enemy to apply its Dexterity bonus to AC (if any). This attack must be made before the end of your next turn.
Improved Parry.shortDescription: Parry an opponent to make it flat-footed

Improved Planar Infusion.shortDescription: Gain an improved infusion from a plane

Improved Planar Mentor.shortDescription: Gain access to several spell-like abilities while benefiting from Planar Mentor

Improved Plane Shift.shortDescription: Learn plane shift as a 5th-level spell and identify planes more easily

Improved Position of Strength.prereqs: Position of Strength; Two-Weapon Fighting or Multiattack; Intimidate 5 ranks
description: Improved Position of Strength (Combat)
Source ~`Villain Codex pg. 188`~
You are particularly skilled in pressing your advantage when negotiating with noncombatants.
***Prerequisites:*** ~`Position of Strength`~; Two-Weapon Fighting or Multiattack; Intimidate 5 ranks.

***Benefit:*** As long as you are wielding one or more weapons with which you are proficient, you gain the bonus on Intimidate checks from Position of Strength against creatures that are armed with fewer weapons than you are wielding.
Improved Position of Strength.shortDescription: Gain the bonus from Position of Strength even when target is armed

Improved Possession.prereqs: Demonic Possession or shadow demon, Cha 25
description: Improved Possession
Source ~`Demons Revisited pg. 32`~
Your ability to possess bodies is more powerful.
***Prerequisites:*** Demonic Possession or shadow demon, Cha 25

***Benefit:*** The duration of your magic jar spell-like ability increases to 24 hours. You can choose to activate a host body's extraordinary abilities, supernatural abilities, spelllike abilities, and spells known or prepared.
Improved Possession.shortDescription: Improve the power and duration of your magic jar spell-like ability.

Improved Precise Shot.prereqs: Dex 19, Precise Shot, base attack bonus +11
Improved Precise Shot.shortDescription: No cover or concealment chance on ranged attacks

Improved Precise Strike.prereqs: Dex 13, Precise Strike, base attack bonus +4
description: Improved Precise Strike (Combat, Teamwork)
Source ~`Legacy of the First World pg. 19`~
Your precise timing and smooth teamwork allow you to strike a foe where it hurts.
***Prerequisites:*** Dex 13, ~`Precise Strike`~, base attack bonus +4.
***Benefit:*** Whenever you deal additional damage with Precise Strike, you also deal 1 point of bleed damage. This bleed damage does not stack with itself.
Improved Precise Strike.shortDescription: Deal bleed damage with Precise Strike

Improved Punishing Step.prereqs: Dex 13, Dodge, Punishing Step, base attack bonus +8
description: Improved Punishing Step (Combat)
Source ~`Monster Hunter's Handbook pg. 14`~
You know how to take advantage of a devastating charge.
***Prerequisites:*** Dex 13, ~`Dodge`~, ~`Punishing Step`~, base attack bonus +8.

***Benefit:*** Your bonus to AC from the Dodge feat increases to +2 against charge attacks. When a creature charges you and misses with its attack, it loses its Dexterity bonus to AC against the next melee attack you make against it before the end of your next turn. If a creature misses with multiple attacks (such as when using the pounce ability), you can make one such attack against the creature's flat-footed AC before the end of your next turn for each of that creature's attacks that missed you.
Improved Punishing Step.shortDescription: Creature's that charge you and miss are flat-footed against your attacks

Improved Rending Fury.prereqs: Rending Fury, base attack bonus +9, rend special attack
Improved Rending Fury.shortDescription: Deal extra damage on a successful rend

Improved Reposition.shortDescription: +2 bonus on reposition attempts, no attack of opportunity

Improved Roar.shortDescription: Increase the power and range of the bunyip's roar

Improved Sabotaging Sunder.prereqs: Str 13, Improved Sunder, Power Attack, Sabotaging Sunder, Disable Device 9 ranks
Improved Sabotaging Sunder.shortDescription: Use Sabotaging Sunder on more objects and without provoking attacks of opportunity

Improved Second Chance.prereqs: Int 13, Combat Expertise, Second Chance, base attack bonus +11
Improved Second Chance.shortDescription: Take a -5 penalty on later attacks to reroll missed attack

Improved Shadowy Resistance.shortDescription: Gain resistance to life-sapping magic and effects

Improved Share Spells.prereqs: Spellcraft 10 ranks, ability to acquire an animal companion, eidolon, familiar, or special mount.
Improved Share Spells.shortDescription: Spells affect both you and your bonded creature

description: Improved Shield Bash (Combat)
Source ~`PRPG Core Rulebook pg. 128`~
You can protect yourself with your shield, even if you use it to attack.
***Prerequisites:*** ~`Shield Proficiency.`~
***Benefit:*** When you perform a shield bash, you may still apply the shield's shield bonus to your AC.
***Normal:*** Without this feat, a character that performs a shield bash loses the shield's shield bonus to AC until his next turn (see Equipment).
~`Combat Trick`~ (from the ~`Combat Stamina`~ feat)
Source ~`Pathfinder Unchained pg. 123`~

When attempting a shield bash attack, you can spend 5 stamina points to either wield a heavy shield as if it were a light weapon or gain a +2 bonus on the shield bash attack roll with a light shield. Whichever option you choose, the effect lasts until the start of your next turn.
Improved Shield Bash.shortDescription: Keep your shield bonus when shield bashing

Improved Shield Focus.shortDescription: Decrease shield's armor check penalty by 1

Improved Sidestep.shortDescription: Sidestep without using your 5-foot step on your next turn

Improved Snap Shot.prereqs: Dex 15, Point-Blank Shot, Rapid Shot, Snap Shot, Weapon Focus, base attack bonus +9
description: Improved Snap Shot (Combat)
Source ~`Ultimate Combat pg. 106`~
You can take advantage of your opponent's vulnerabilities from a greater distance, and without exposing yourself.
***Prerequisites:*** Dex 15, ~`Point-Blank Shot`~, ~`Rapid Shot`~, ~`Snap Shot`~, ~`Weapon Focus`~, base attack bonus +9.
***Benefit:*** You threaten an additional 5 feet with Snap Shot.
***Normal:*** Making a ranged attack provokes attacks of opportunity.
~`Combat Trick`~ (from the ~`Combat Stamina`~ feat)
Source ~`Pathfinder Unchained pg. 123`~

At the end of your turn, you can spend 5 stamina points to threaten an additional 15 feet with Snap ShotAPG (instead of an additional 10 feet) until you take an attack of opportunity against an opponent in the expanded threat range or the beginning of your next turn, whichever comes first.
Improved Snap Shot.shortDescription: You threaten an additional 10 feet with Snap Shot

Improved Spell Sharing.prereqs: Ability to acquire an animal companion, eidolon, familiar, or special mount
description: Improved Spell Sharing (Teamwork)
Source ~`Advanced Class Guide pg. 150`~
Your link with your companion creature allows you to share your magic with it.
***Prerequisites:*** Ability to acquire an animal companion, eidolon, familiar, or special mount.

***Benefit:*** When you are adjacent to or sharing a square with your companion creature and that companion creature has this feat, you can cast a spell on yourself and divide the duration evenly between yourself and the companion creature. You can use this feat only on spells with a duration of at least 2 rounds. For example, you could cast bull's strength on yourself, and instead of the spell lasting 1 minute per level on yourself, it lasts 5 rounds per level on yourself and 5 rounds per level on your companion.
Once the spell is cast, you and the companion creature can move farther apart without ending the effect.
Improved Spell Sharing.shortDescription: Divide spell duration with the companion creature

Improved Spring Attack.prereqs: Dex 15, Dodge, Mobility, Nimble Moves, Spring Attack, base attack bonus +9
description: Improved Spring Attack (Combat)
Source ~`Ultimate Wilderness pg. 114`~
You dart through the press of battle like a breeze, assaulting foes as you pass.
***Prerequisites:*** Dex 15, ~`Dodge`~, ~`Mobility`~, ~`Nimble Moves`~, ~`Spring Attack`~, base attack bonus +9.

***Benefit:*** When you use Spring Attack, you can select two targets to attack during your movement instead of one. The second attack made this way is made at your full base attack bonus - 5. All restrictions of Spring Attack apply to both targets, and your movement does not provoke attacks of opportunity from either target. You can't target the same creature twice.
***Special:*** A monk of at least 14th level can select this feat as a monk bonus feat, but only if he has Spring Attack.
Improved Spring Attack.shortDescription: Attack up to two targets intead of one when you use Spring Attack

Improved Stalwart.prereqs: Diehard, Endurance, Stalwart, base attack bonus +11
description: Improved Stalwart
Source ~`Ultimate Combat pg. 106`~
You can roll with the punches while simultaneously striking back at your attackers.
***Prerequisites:*** ~`Diehard`~, ~`Endurance`~, ~`Stalwart`~, base attack bonus +11.
***Benefit:*** Double the DR you gain from Stalwart, to a maximum of DR 10/-.

Improved Steal.shortDescription: +2 bonus on steal attempts, no attack of opportunity

Improved Stellar Wanderer.shortDescription: When you use Stellar Wanderer, you can bring along up to 8 creatures

description: Improved Stench
Source ~`Demons Revisited pg. 26`~
Your foul odor is particularly strong and wide-reaching.
***Prerequisites:*** Stench universal monster ability.
***Benefit:*** The aura range of your stench ability increases by 30 feet. In addition, your stench ability save DC increases by 2, and its duration increases by 50%.
Improved Stench.shortDescription: Increase the power of your stench.

description: Improved Stonecunning
Source ~`Advanced Player's Guide pg. 163`~
Your sense for stonework is uncanny.
***Prerequisites:*** Wis 13, dwarf, stonecunning racial trait.
***Benefit:*** You receive a +4 bonus on Perception checks to notice unusual stonework. This bonus replaces the stonecunning ability's normal bonus on Perception checks.
Mythic Improved Stonecunning
Source ~`Mythic Adventures pg. 67`~
If you listen close, you can hear the secrets of stone.
***Prerequisites:*** ~`Improved Stonecunning.`~
***Benefit:*** You gain stone tell as a spell-like ability usable once per day with a caster level equal to twice your tier.
Improved Stonecunning.shortDescription: +4 bonus on Perception checks to notice unusual stonework

Improved Studied Combatant.prereqs: Int 13, Amateur Investigator, Studied Combatant, base attack bonus +8, 1 rank in at least one Knowledge skill, no levels in a class that has the inspiration class feature
Improved Studied Combatant.shortDescription: Studied strike grants a +4 bonus on attack rolls and damage rolls

description: Improved Sunder (Combat)
Source ~`PRPG Core Rulebook pg. 128`~
You are skilled at damaging your foes' weapons and armor.
***Prerequisites:*** Str 13, ~`Power Attack`~, base attack bonus +1.

***Benefit:*** You do not provoke an attack of opportunity when performing a sunder combat maneuver. In addition, you receive a +2 bonus on checks made to sunder an item. You also receive a +2 bonus to your Combat Maneuver Defense whenever an opponent tries to sunder your gear.
***Normal:*** You provoke an attack of opportunity when performing a sunder combat maneuver.
~`Combat Trick`~ (from the ~`Combat Stamina`~ feat)
Source ~`Pathfinder Unchained pg. 124`~

When you are the target of a sunder combat maneuver, you can spend a number of stamina points up to your Strength or Dexterity bonus, whichever is greater. Your CMD increases by that number for that sunder attempt.
Mythic Improved Sunder
Source ~`Mythic Adventures pg. 67`~
Your mighty smashing blows demolish objects.
***Prerequisites:*** ~`Improved Sunder.`~

***Benefit:*** You gain a bonus equal to half your tier on checks to sunder, and to your CMD when an opponent tries to sunder an object used by you. These bonuses stack with those granted by Improved Sunder.
Furthermore, you can make an attack of opportunity against any creature that attempts to sunder an object used by you, unless it also has this feat.
Improved Sunder.shortDescription: +2 bonus on sunder attempts, no attack of opportunity

Improved Surprise Follow-Through.prereqs: Str 13, Cleave, Great Cleave, Power Attack, Surprise Follow Through, base attack bonus +8
description: Improved Surprise Follow-Through (Combat)
Source ~`Advanced Race Guide pg. 57`~
You follow up an attack with a surprising series of sweeping blows.
***Prerequisites:*** Str 13, ~`Cleave`~, ~`Great Cleave`~, ~`Power Attack`~, Surprise Follow Through, base attack bonus +8.
***Benefit:*** When using Great Cleave, each opponent you attack on your turn (other than the first) is denied his Dexterity bonus against you.
~`Combat Trick`~ (from the ~`Combat Stamina`~ feat)
Source ~`Pathfinder Unchained pg. 124`~
When you hit a foe that's denied its Dexterity bonus via this feat and you use the Surprise Follow-Through combat trick to deal extra damage, the amount of extra damage dealt increases to 1d6 points.
Improved Surprise Follow-Through.shortDescription: Deny opponents their Dex bonus when using Great Cleave

Improved Swap Places.shortDescription: When you use Swap Places, your ally can be smaller or larger and your movement does not provoke attacks of opportunity

Improved Swarm Form.shortDescription: Learn to assume the form of a multitude of vermin

description: Improved Toxicological Timing
Source ~`Alchemy Manual pg. 8`~
You know how to adjust the amount of time required for a poison to take effect.
***Prerequisites:*** Craft (alchemy) 11 ranks, ~`Toxicological Timing.`~
***Benefit:*** Whenever you craft a poison with the Craft (alchemy) skill, you can add or subtract up to 1 day from its onset time (to a minimum onset period of 1 round).
Improved Toxicological Timing.shortDescription: Increase or decrease the onset time of poisons

description: Improved Trip (Combat)
Source ~`PRPG Core Rulebook pg. 128`~
You are skilled at sending your opponents to the ground.
***Prerequisites:*** Int 13, ~`Combat Expertise.`~

***Benefit:*** You do not provoke an attack of opportunity when performing a trip combat maneuver. In addition, you receive a +2 bonus on checks made to trip a foe. You also receive a +2 bonus to your Combat Maneuver Defense whenever an opponent tries to trip you.
***Normal:*** You provoke an attack of opportunity when performing a trip combat maneuver.
~`Combat Trick`~ (from the ~`Combat Stamina`~ feat)
Source ~`Pathfinder Unchained pg. 124`~

You can select this feat even if you don't meet the ability score prerequisite (Intelligence 13). You gain the benefits of this feat only as long as you have at least 1 stamina point in your stamina pool. When you are the target of a trip combat maneuver, you can spend a number of stamina points up to your Strength or Dexterity bonus, whichever is greater. Your CMD against that trip attempt increases by that number.
Mythic Improved Trip
Source ~`Mythic Adventures pg. 68`~
You're expert at knocking your foes down.
***Prerequisites:*** ~`Improved Trip.`~
***Benefit:*** You gain a bonus equal to half your tier on checks to trip, and to your CMD when an opponent tries to trip you. These bonuses stack with those granted by Improved Trip.
Furthermore, you can make an attack of opportunity against any creature that attempts to trip you, unless it also has this feat.
Improved Trip.shortDescription: +2 bonus on trip attempts, no attack of opportunity

Improved Two-Weapon Feint.prereqs: Dex 17, Int 13, Combat Expertise, Improved Two-Weapon Fighting, Two-Weapon Feint, Two-Weapon Fighting, base attack bonus +6
description: Improved Two-Weapon Feint (Combat)
Source ~`Ultimate Combat pg. 106`~
Your primary weapon keeps a foe off balance, allowing you to slip your off-hand weapon past his defenses.
***Prerequisites:*** Dex 17, Int 13, ~`Combat Expertise`~, ~`Improved Two-Weapon Fighting`~, ~`Two-Weapon Feint`~, ~`Two-Weapon Fighting`~, base attack bonus +6.

***Benefit:*** While using Two-Weapon Fighting to make melee attacks, you can forgo your first primary-hand melee attack to make a Bluff check to feint an opponent. If you successfully feint, that opponent is denied his Dexterity bonus to AC until the end of your turn.
~`Combat Trick`~ (from the ~`Combat Stamina`~ feat)
Source ~`Pathfinder Unchained pg. 124`~

You can select this feat even if you don't meet the ability score prerequisite (Intelligence 13). You gain the benefits of this feat only as long as you have at least 1 stamina point in your stamina pool. You can spend 5 stamina points to increase the duration for which the opponent is denied its Dexterity bonus until the start of your next turn.
Improved Two-Weapon Feint.shortDescription: Make a Bluff check instead of your first attack

Improved Two-Weapon Fighting.prereqs: Dex 17, Two-Weapon Fighting, base attack bonus +6
description: Improved Two-Weapon Fighting (Combat)
Source ~`PRPG Core Rulebook pg. 128`~
You are skilled at fighting with two weapons.
***Prerequisites:*** Dex 17, ~`Two-Weapon Fighting`~, base attack bonus +6.
***Benefit:*** In addition to the standard single extra attack you get with an off-hand weapon, you get a second attack with it, albeit at a -5 penalty.
***Normal:*** Without this feat, you can only get a single extra attack with an off-hand weapon.
~`Combat Trick`~ (from the ~`Combat Stamina`~ feat)
Source ~`Pathfinder Unchained pg. 124`~
When making an attack of opportunity, you can spend 5 stamina points to also make an attack of opportunity with your off-hand weapon. That second attack takes a -5 penalty.

Improved Umbral Scion.prereqs: Cha 13, Wis 13, Drow Nobility, Greater Drow Nobility, Improved Drow Nobility, Umbral Scion, able to use drow spell-like abilities, drow
Improved Umbral Scion.shortDescription: Enhance the spell-like abilities which mark you as drow nobility

Improved Uncivilized Tactics.shortDescription: +2 bonus to use Uncivilized Tactics, stop provoking attacks when using

Improved Underhanded Teamwork.prereqs: Combat Expertise, Improved Dirty Trick, Underhanded Teamwork, base attack bonus +6
description: Improved Underhanded Teamwork (Combat, Teamwork)
Source ~`Pathfinder Society Primer pg. 15`~
You and your allies have trained together long enough
to know how to exploit an opponent's disadvantage to
make her predicament even worse.
***Prerequisites:*** ~`Combat Expertise`~, ~`Improved Dirty Trick`~, ~`Underhanded Teamwork`~, base attack bonus +6.
***Benefit:*** Whenever an ally who also has this feat
performs the dirty trick combat maneuver against a foe
that you both threaten, you may attempt a dirty trick
combat maneuver against the same foe as an immediate
action to inflict a second condition. If the foe uses an
action to remove the first condition, it also removes the
condition imposed by your immediate action.
Improved Underhanded Teamwork.shortDescription: Attempt a dirty trick when a nearby ally does so

Improved Vital Strike.shortDescription: Deal three times the normal damage on a single attack

Improved Weapon of the Chosen.prereqs: Weapon Focus with your deity's favored weapon, Weapon of the Chosen
Improved Weapon of the Chosen.shortDescription: Gain the benefits of Weapon of the Chosen until the start of your next turn

Improved Weapon Shift.prereqs: Weapon Shift, base attack bonus +6, wild shape class feature
description: Improved Weapon Shift
Source ~`Wilderness Origins pg. 9`~
When you change forms, your natural attacks take on not just the physical properties of your weapons, but their magical abilities as well.
***Prerequisites:*** ~`Weapon Shift`~, base attack bonus +6, wild shape class feature.

***Benefit:*** When you apply a melee weapon's damage type and properties to your natural attacks using the ~`Weapon Shift`~ feat, your natural attacks also gain the weapon special abilities of the weapon, such as the ~`flaming`~ special ability. Improved Weapon Shift does not apply the ~`dancing`~ special ability or any special abilities limited to thrown or ranged weapons, and it does not apply the weapon's enhancement bonuses to your attacks.
Improved Weapon Shift.shortDescription: When using Weapon Shift, gain the magical special properties of your weapon

Improved Whip Mastery.prereqs: Weapon Focus (whip), Whip Mastery, base attack bonus +5
description: Improved Whip Mastery (Combat)
Source ~`Ultimate Combat pg. 106`~
You are able to entangle opponents with the coils of your whip.
***Prerequisites:*** ~`Weapon Focus (whip)`~, ~`Whip Mastery`~, base attack bonus +5.

***Benefit:*** While wielding a whip, you threaten the area of your natural reach plus 5 feet. You can also use a whip to grasp an unattended Small or Tiny object within your whip's reach and pull that object into your square. To do so, you must hit AC 10 with a melee touch attack. Further, you can use the whip to grasp onto an object within your whip's reach, using 5 feet of your whip as if it were a grappling hook, allowing you to use the rest of your whip to swing on like a rope. As a free action, you can release the object your whip is grasping, but you cannot use the whip to attack while the whip is grasping an object.
~`Combat Trick`~ (from the ~`Combat Stamina`~ feat)
Source ~`Pathfinder Unchained pg. 124`~

At the start of your turn, you can spend 5 stamina points to increase the radius of the area you threaten while wielding a whip by an additional 5 feet until you make an attack against an opponent in the expanded reach or the beginning of your next turn, whichever comes first.
Improved Whip Mastery.shortDescription: Threaten with your whip and grasp Tiny objects

Improved Wilding Strike.prereqs: Str 16, Improved Unarmed Strike, Wilding, Wilding Strike, base attack bonus +11
Improved Wilding Strike.shortDescription: Your unarmed strike damage increases to 1d8 (or 1d6 if you are Small)

description: Improvisation
Source ~`Advanced Race Guide pg. 77`~
You can figure out how to do almost anything.
***Prerequisites:*** Int 13, ~`Fast Learner`~, human.
***Benefit:*** You gain a +2 bonus on all skill checks for skills you have no ranks in. Furthermore, you can use all skills designated "trained only" untrained.
Improvisation.shortDescription: +2 bonus on skills with no ranks, all trained skills may be used untrained

Improvisational Focus.prereqs: Catch Off-Guard or Throw Anything, base attack bonus +1
Improvisational Focus.shortDescription: Gain proficiency and Weapon Focus with improvised weapons

Improvisational Healer.shortDescription: Gain bonuses when using the Heal skill

Improvised Defenses.prereqs: Catch Off-Guard or Throw Anything, base attack bonus +1
description: Improvised Defenses (Combat)
Source ~`Martial Arts Handbook pg. 9`~
You can deftly defend yourself with makeshift weapons.
***Prerequisites:*** ~`Catch Off-Guard`~ or ~`Throw Anything`~, base attack bonus +1.
***Benefit:*** You gain a +1 shield bonus to AC when you are wielding an improvised weapon and have your other hand free.
Improvised Defenses.shortDescription: Gain a +1 shield bonus to AC when wielding an improvised weapon

Improvised Weapon Mastery.prereqs: Catch Off-Guard or Throw Anything, base attack bonus +8
description: Improvised Weapon Mastery (Combat)
Source ~`PRPG Core Rulebook pg. 128`~
You can turn nearly any object into a deadly weapon, from a razor-sharp chair leg to a sack of flour.
***Prerequisites:*** Catch Off-Guard or Throw Anything, base attack bonus +8.

***Benefit:*** You do not suffer any penalties for using an improvised weapon. Increase the amount of damage dealt by the improvised weapon by one step (for example, 1d4 becomes 1d6) to a maximum of 1d8 (2d6 if the improvised weapon is two-handed). The improvised weapon has a critical threat range of 19-20, with a critical multiplier of ??2.
~`Combat Trick`~ (from the ~`Combat Stamina`~ feat)
Source ~`Pathfinder Unchained pg. 124`~

When making an improvised weapon attack, you can spend 2 stamina points to increase the damage of the attack by an additional step (to a maximum of 1d10, or 2d8 if the improvised weapon is two-handed).

In Harm's Way.shortDescription: Take the damage of a successful attack upon an adjacent ally

Incite Paranoia.prereqs: Int 13, Combat Expertise, Deceitful Greater Feint, Improved Feint, base attack bonus +6
Incite Paranoia.shortDescription: Ruin your foes' teamwork and spread doubt among them

Incorporeal Intuition.prereqs: Psychic Sensitivity or the ability to cast psychic spells, Spirit Sense
Incorporeal Intuition.shortDescription: Notice adjacent incorporeal creatures inside walls

description: Incredible Healer
Source ~`Blood of the Ancients pg. 20`~
You are able to treat deadly wounds with an almost supernatural skill.
***Prerequisites:*** Heal 5 ranks.

***Benefit:*** When you use the Heal skill to treat deadly wounds, the target heals a number of hit points equal to either the result of your Heal check or the normal amount, whichever is higher. A creature can still benefit from having deadly wounds treated no more than once per day.
Incredible Healer.shortDescription: Heal extra hit points when you treat deadly wounds with a Heal check

description: Incremental Elemental Assault
Source ~`Advanced Race Guide pg. 203`~
You may activate and quench your elemental assault ability multiple times per day.
***Prerequisites:*** Suli.

***Benefit:*** You may use your elemental assault ability in 1-round increments, up to a maximum number of rounds per day equal to your character level. These rounds do not have to be consecutive. Activating the ability is a swift action; ending it is a free action.
***Normal:*** You can use elemental assault once per day. It lasts a number of rounds equal to your class level.
Incremental Elemental Assault.shortDescription: Use your elemental assault in 1-round increments

Indigestible.prereqs: Favored enemy (ooze) or survived engulfing by an ooze

Indomitable Mount.prereqs: Mounted Combat, Handle Animal 5 ranks, Ride 5 ranks, Lastwall affinity
description: Indomitable Mount (Combat)
Source ~`Cities of Golarion pg. 50`~
Your skill at riding helps your mount avoid attacks.
***Prerequisites:*** ~`Mounted Combat`~, Handle Animal 5 ranks, Ride 5 ranks, Lastwall affinity.

***Benefit:*** Once per round when your mount must make a saving throw, you can make a Ride check as an immediate action. Your mount makes its save if your Ride check result is greater than the DC of the opponent's attack.
Indomitable Mount.shortDescription: Make ride checks in place of your mount's saving throw

Indomitable Mountain Avalanche.prereqs: Wis 15, Combat Reflexes, Improved Unarmed Strike, Indomitable Mountain Peak, Indomitable Mountain Style, base attack bonus +9
description: Indomitable Mountain Avalanche (Combat)
Source ~`Ultimate Wilderness pg. 114`~
You are an impassable mountain, hurling your enemies back.
***Prerequisites:*** Wis 15, ~`Combat Reflexes`~, ~`Improved Unarmed Strike`~, ~`Indomitable Mountain Peak`~, ~`Indomitable Mountain Style`~, base attack bonus +9.

***Benefit:*** If an opponent fails at a combat maneuver against you, you can use an attack of opportunity to make a melee attack against the opponent using your highest attack bonus. If the attack hits, instead of dealing damage, you can push the opponent back 5 feet for every 5 by which it failed its combat maneuver check (minimum 5 feet). Additionally, when you hit with an unarmed melee attack against an opponent who provoked an attack of opportunity by failing its Acrobatics check to move through a space you threaten, you can push the opponent back 5 feet instead of dealing damage. The opponent moves back in a straight line, but stops before hitting any obstacle or hazard.
Indomitable Mountain Avalanche.shortDescription: Make attack of opportunity to push back a foe when a foe fails a combat maneuver against you

Indomitable Mountain Peak.prereqs: Wis 15, Combat Reflexes, Improved Unarmed Strike, Indomitable Mountain Style, base attack bonus +6
Indomitable Mountain Peak.shortDescription: Gain +2 to CMD against combat manuever checks or Acrobatics checks to avoid provoking your attacks of opportunity when a previous attempt succeeds

Indomitable Mountain Style.prereqs: Wis 13, Combat Reflexes, Improved Unarmed Strike, base attack bonus +4
description: Indomitable Mountain Style (Combat, Style)
Source ~`Ultimate Wilderness pg. 115`~
Like a rugged mountain, you are impassable and unmovable.
***Prerequisites:*** Wis 13, ~`Combat Reflexes`~, ~`Improved Unarmed Strike`~, base attack bonus +4.

***Benefit:*** As long as you do not take a move action, you gain a +4 morale bonus to your CMD and to the DC of Bluff checks used for feint attempts against you. Additionally, you are considered to be one size category larger for the purpose of calculating your CMD when creatures attempt Acrobatics checks to move through spaces you threaten without provoking attacks of opportunity.
Indomitable Mountain Style.shortDescription: Gain +4 morale bonus to CMD and to the DC of Bluff checks used for feint attempts against you if you don't move

Ineffable Count of the Clock.prereqs: Fey creature type or Fey Obedience (Shyka), you must have either visited or interacted with an outsider from the Dimension of Time
Ineffable Count of the Clock.shortDescription: You can borrow speed from the future

Inerrant Justice.prereqs: Must have witnessed or suffered a grave injustice that went unpunished, or have the An Eye for an Eye or the Raiders background. If the offender is not a challenging foe, it either advances to become one or allies with one or more creatures who are
Inerrant Justice.shortDescription: Take minimum damage from an attack

Inexplicable Luck.shortDescription: 1/day, +8 bonus before a roll is made or +4 after

Infectious Weapons.prereqs: Ability to cause disease with a natural weapon via an extraordinary or supernatural ability
Infectious Weapons.shortDescription: Your disease spreads to the weapons you wield

Infernal Legist.shortDescription: You can instantly create a diabolic contact.

Infiltrator.prereqs: Must have adopted an assumed or secret identity associated with an enemy organization
description: Infiltrator (Story)
Source ~`Spymaster's Handbook pg. 15`~
You have sacrificed your true identity in order to achieve your goal.
***Prerequisites:*** Must have adopted an assumed or secret identity associated with an enemy organization.

***Benefit:*** Once per day when you succeed at a saving throw to negate a divination, you learn what the divination would have revealed and can spend an immediate action to cause the divination to return appropriate false information you imagine that would fit with your cover identity.
***Goal:*** Thwart the organization you have infiltrated, defeating or turning to your cause an appropriate number of challenging foes in the process

***Completion Benefit:*** Whenever a spell or spell-like ability would reveal information about you, you can attempt a Will saving throw. If your saving throw is successful, the spell reveals nothing about you. You can use this feat's benefits to instead give false information, as detailed above.
Infiltrator.shortDescription: Make a divination spell return false information

Infuse Poison.prereqs: Brew Potion, Craft (alchemy) 5 ranks, caster level 3rd

Infused Spell Cartridges.prereqs: Int 15, Arcane Strike, Spell Cartridges, ability to cast 4th-level arcane spells, proficient with firearms
Infused Spell Cartridges.shortDescription: You can deliver a touch spell through a force bullet

description: Innate Arcana
Source ~`Monster Codex pg. 200`~
You can refresh your spell-like abilities by expending spell energy.
***Prerequisites:*** Arcane spellcaster, caster level 4th, serpentfolk.

***Benefit:*** You can expend two arcane spell slots or prepared spells to cast one of your racial spell-like abilities. The level of each expended spell must be equal to or higher than the sorcerer/wizard spell level of the spell-like ability you want to cast.
Innate Arcana.shortDescription: Expend prepared arcane magic to re-use a spell-like ability

Innate Flexibility.prereqs: Duergar, two racial spell-like abilities usable once per day
Innate Flexibility.shortDescription: Gain additional uses of your spell-like abilities

Inner Breath.shortDescription: You no longer need to breathe

Inner Flame.shortDescription: +4 save vs. fire/light spells, deal extra damage with Scorching Weapons

Innocent Blood.prereqs: You must slay at least 50 intelligent noncombatants for either your own personal gain or for no cause at all, or have the Bloodthirsty, First Kill, or The Kill background.
description: Innocent Blood (Story)
Source ~`Ultimate Campaign pg. 69`~
With their deaths, the pitiful wretches that inhabit this
world open your path to greatness.
***Prerequisites:*** You must slay at least 50 intelligent
noncombatants for either your own personal gain or for
no cause at all, or have the Bloodthirsty, First Kill, or The
Kill background.
***Benefit:*** You gain a +2 bonus on Intimidate checks.
If you have 10 or more ranks in Intimidate, this bonus
increases to +4. Each time you slay an intelligent creature,
you gain a +1 bonus on attack rolls and caster level checks
for 1 minute (this bonus does not stack with itself ).
***Goal:*** Slay at least 200 more intelligent noncombatants,
then slay a challenging foe that seeks to either bring you
to justice for your crimes or usurp your position.
***Completion Benefit:*** Any shaken creature takes double
the normal penalties when attacking you, making saves
against your abilities, or resolving skill checks with you
as a target.
Innocent Blood.shortDescription: Be more intimidating than ever before

Inscribe Magical Tattoo.prereqs: Craft (calligraphy, paintings, or tattoos) 5 ranks, caster level 5th
description: Inscribe Magical Tattoo (Item Creation)
Source ~`Inner Sea Magic pg. 16`~
You can craft magical tattoos.
***Prerequisites:*** Craft (calligraphy, paintings, or tattoos) 5 ranks, caster level 5th

***Benefit:*** You can create magical tattoos, magic items inked directly into the flesh of a willing or helpless creature. Both you and the recipient of the tattoo (if the recipient is not yourself) must be present during the entire tattooing process. Magic tattoos must be placed on a part of the body normally able to hold a magic item slot, but they do not count against or interfere with magic items worn on those slots. A single slot can only hold one magical tattoo (nonmagical tattoos and tattoos acquired from the tattooed sorcerer archetype do not count against this limit). Tattoos may be inscribed on the following slots: belt, body, chest, feet, hands, head, neck, shoulder, ring (up to two), or wrist. They cannot be inscribed on armor, eye, headband, or shield slots.

Magical tattoos are difficult to destroy, though they count as magic items for the purposes of dispel magic. The spell erase can permanently destroy a magical tattoo, but the bearer of the tattoo can resist the spell with a Will save, in addition to the caster needing to make a successful caster level check to erase the tattoo. Physically removing a magical tattoo with a sharp instrument or defacing it with fire or acid can destroy it as well. Doing so is a full-round action that not only requires the target to be willing or helpless, but also provokes attacks of opportunity. At least 2 points of damage per caster level of the tattoo must be dealt to destroy a magical tattoo in this manner.

Magical tattoos follow the rules for magic item creation as though they were wondrous items, except that they can use the Craft (calligraphy, paintings, tattoos) skill. New magical tattoos can be researched and designed using the guidelines for pricing new magic items. Magical tattoos are treated as slotless magical items for pricing purposes.
Inscribe Rune (Item Creation)
Source ~`Pathfinder #5: Sins of the Saviors pg. 57`~
You can tattoo arcane runes upon your flesh or the flesh of others.
***Prerequisites:*** Caster level 3rd.

***Benefit:*** You can create runes. Inscribing a rune takes one day for each 1,000 gp in its base price. To inscribe a rune, you must spend 1/25 of its base price in XP and use up raw materials costing half of its base price.
Inscribe Rune.shortDescription: Learn to create Thassilonian rune tattoos

Insidious Healing.shortDescription: Creatures who accept your healing a more vulnerable to your spells

Insightful Delivery.prereqs: Poison use class feature, studied strike +4d6
description: Insightful Delivery
Source ~`Advanced Class Guide pg. 151`~
Your knowledge of where to strike makes your poisons more deadly.
***Prerequisites:*** Poison use class feature, studied strike +4d6.
***Benefit:*** When you use a poisoned weapon to attempt an attack in conjunction with studied strike, the DC to resist the poison increases by half the number of your studied strike dice.
Insightful Delivery.shortDescription: Increase the DC of poison delivered with studied strike

Insightful Gaze.prereqs: Stern gaze class feature, Sense Motive 5 ranks
Insightful Gaze.shortDescription: When using Sense Motive, roll twice and take the higher roll

description: Inspirational Commander
Source ~`Quests and Campaigns pg. 27`~
Armies under your command enjoy higher morale
thanks to your excellent leadership.
***Prerequisites:*** Charisma 13.
***Benefit:*** You or any army that is under your command
gains a +2 bonus on Morale checks. Additionally, you
gain two additional boons of your choice (see page 240 of
Ultimate Campaign).
Inspirational Commander.shortDescription: Increase the morale of men under your command

Inspired Alchemy.prereqs: Ability to create 2nd-level extracts, alchemy class feature, inspiration- class feature
Inspired Alchemy.shortDescription: Spend time and inspiration to recreate a consumed extract

Inspired by Fear.prereqs: Ability to perform dirge of doom
Inspired by Fear.shortDescription: You and allies in your dirge of doom effect gain a +4 bonus against fear

Inspired Sneak Attack.prereqs: Inspiration pool; sneak attack or studied strike class feature
description: Inspired Sneak Attack (Combat)
Source ~`Dirty Tactics Toolbox pg. 11`~
Your brilliant insight makes you more dangerous in combat.
***Prerequisites:*** Inspiration pool; sneak attack or studied strike class feature.

***Benefit:*** When dealing sneak attack or studied strike damage, you can expend a use of inspiration from your pool to reroll all of your sneak attack dice that resulted in 1s. If you have the powerful sneak rogue talent, rather than treat all 1s on your sneak attack damage dice as 2s, you can reroll all your sneak attack dice that resulted in 1s. If you have the deadly sneak advanced rogue talent, rather than treat all 1s and 2s on your sneak attack damage dice as 3s, you can reroll all your sneak attack damage dice that resulted in 1s or 2s. In either case, you must take the result of the rerolls, even if it's worse than the original result.
Inspired Sneak Attack.shortDescription: Expend uses of inspiration to reroll sneak attack dice

Inspired Strike.shortDescription: Expend inspiration to increase the damage dealt with the studied combat

Inspiring Bravery.shortDescription: Grant your bravery to allies within 30 feet

description: Inspiring Mentor
Source ~`Ultimate Intrigue pg. 85`~
Others listen to your words of encouragement and perform acts above and beyond as a result.
***Prerequisites:*** Cha 13, inspire competence bardic performance.
***Benefit:*** Inspire competence now affects all allies within 30 feet who can hear your performance, as long as they are attempting the skill you've selected.
***Normal:*** Inspire competence only affects one ally.
Inspiring Mentor.shortDescription: Inspire competence affects allies within 30 feet

Inspiring Talent.prereqs: Half-elf, adaptability or ancestral arms racial trait
Inspiring Talent.shortDescription: Share benefits of an ally's Skill Focus or weapon proficiencies in certain situations

description: Instant Alchemy
Source ~`Alchemy Manual pg. 5`~
You can perform simple alchemical tasks with preternatural speed.
***Prerequisites:*** Craft (alchemy) 1 rank.

***Benefit:*** When performing spontaneous alchemy, you can craft an alchemical item as a standard action if its total crafting time is 10 minutes or less and you have all the equipment and materials required in hand. Items that require 1 hour to create with spontaneous alchemy take you only 10 minutes, and items that require 1 day take you only 1 hour. If you have the alchemy class feature, you can identify a potion using the Craft (alchemy) skill as if using detect magic as a swift action rather than a standard action.
Instant Alchemy.shortDescription: Create simple alchemical items with preternatural speed

Instant Judgment.shortDescription: May pronounce or change a judgment as an immediate action

Instrumental.prereqs: Bardic Performance class feature, Perform (any instrument) 3 ranks
description: Instrumental
Source ~`Classic Treasures Revisited pg. 38`~
You can deliver a breathtaking bardic performance while activating the powers of a magical instrument, or utilize your bardic prowess to enhance the instrument's power.
***Prerequisites:*** Bardic Performance class feature, Perform (any instrument) 3 ranks.

***Benefit:*** When activating a magical instrument as a fullround or standard action, you may begin a bardic performance as a free action. Your performance must use a Perform skill appropriate to the instrument.
Alternatively, you may expand 2 rounds of bardic performance to add +2 to any save DCs associated with the use of the instrument's powers.
If your instrument summons allies, such as pipes of the sewers or the horn of Valhalla, your bardic performances with that instrument affect those allies even if they normally would not.
Instrumental.shortDescription: Start bardic performances with free when activating magical instruments

Intense Blows.prereqs: Str 13, Power Attack, base attack bonus +6 or fighter level 4th, armor training class feature, proficiency with heavy armor.
Intense Blows.shortDescription: Gain a bonus to CMD when using Power Attack

Intense Pain.prereqs: Mesmerist level 7th, painful stare class feature

Intensified Spell.shortDescription: Increase maximum damage dice by 5 levels

Intensified Spell-Like Ability.prereqs: Spell-like ability at caster level 4th or higher
description: Intensified Spell-Like Ability (Monster)
Source ~`Horror Adventures pg. 88`~
Your spell-like ability deals more damage.
***Prerequisites:*** Spell-like ability at caster level 4th or higher.

***Benefit:*** Choose one of your spell-like abilities, subject to the restrictions described in this feat. You can use the chosen spell-like ability as an intensified spell-like ability three times per day (or less, if the ability is normally usable only once or twice per day).

When you use an intensified spell-like ability, the maximum number of the ability's damage dice increases by 5 levels. You must have sufficient caster levels to surpass the normal maximum in order to benefit from this feat. No other variables of the spell-like ability are affected, and spell-like abilities that inflict damage that is not modified by caster level are not affected by this feat.
You can only select a spell-like ability duplicating a spell with a level less than or equal to 1/2 your caster level (round down) - 1. For a summary, see Table 3-1.
***Special:*** This feat can be taken multiple times. Each time it is taken, you can apply it to a different spell-like ability.
Bouncing, disruptive, intensified, lingering, or scarring ability.
Fearsome, sickening, or traumatic ability.
Intensified Spell-Like Ability.shortDescription: Spell-like ability has a higher damage dice cap

Intercept Charge.shortDescription: Move up to your speed to intercept charging foe as an immediate action

Interweave Composite Blast.shortDescription: Work together to unleash a composite blast

Intimidate Animals.prereqs: Greater Wild Empathy, Intimidate 5 ranks, Knowledge (nature) 5 ranks, wild empathy class feature
description: Intimidate Animals (Combat)
Source ~`Ultimate Wilderness pg. 115`~
You are skilled at intimidating animals with your bluster and fury.
***Prerequisites:*** ~`Greater Wild Empathy`~, Intimidate 5 ranks, Knowledge (nature) 5 ranks, wild empathy class feature.

***Benefit:*** You add your Wisdom modifier on Intimidate checks against animals in addition to your Charisma modifier. An animal with 4 or fewer Hit Dice is frightened instead of shaken on a successful Intimidate check to demoralize it.
Intimidate Animals.shortDescription: Add your Wisdom Modifier on Intimidate checks in addition to Charisma modifier when intimidating animals

Intimidating Bane.prereqs: Bane class feature, Dazzling Display, Weapon Focus, character level 8th
Intimidating Bane.shortDescription: Gain +2 bonus on Dazzling Display while bane is active

Intimidating Confidence.prereqs: Cha 13, Fearless Curiosity, Intimidate 5 ranks, human
Intimidating Confidence.shortDescription: +1 save vs. emotion spells, make free Intimidate checks when confirming critical hits

Intimidating Gaze.prereqs: Cha 13+, stern gaze class feature, Intimidate 5 ranks
description: Intimidating Gaze
Source ~`Ultimate Magic pg. 153`~
There is something in your eyes that scares people.
***Prerequisites:*** Cha 13+, stern gaze class feature, Intimidate 5 ranks.
***Benefit:*** Once per day, as a free action, when making an Intimidate skill check, you can roll two dice and take the higher result.
Intimidating Gaze.shortDescription: When using Intimidate, roll twice and take the higher roll

Intimidating Glance.shortDescription: Demoralize hypnotic stare target as a swift action

Intimidating Performance.prereqs: Ability to start a performance (or raging song) as a move action, bardic performance or raging song- class feature
description: Intimidating Performance
Source ~`Advanced Class Guide pg. 151`~
Your performance strikes fear in the hearts of foes.
***Prerequisites:*** Ability to start a performance (or raging song) as a move action, bardic performance or raging song- class feature.

***Benefit:*** When you start a performance (or a raging song) as a move or swift action, you can use a standard action to demoralize a foe (Core Rulebook 99), attempting a Perform check appropriate to your performance in place of the Intimidate check. Your performance must be one with an audible component.
If you can start a performance as a swift action and you have the Dazzling Display feat, you can gain the benefit of Dazzling Display by succeeding at a Perform check in place of an Intimidate check.
Intimidating Performance.shortDescription: Demoralize foes with a successful Perform check

Intimidating Prowess.shortDescription: Add Str to Intimidate in addition to Cha

Intoxicating Flattery.shortDescription: Flatter someone to weaken Wisdom-based checks

Intrepid Rescuer.shortDescription: Those you threaten that attack helpless, prone, or stunned allies provoke an attack of opportunity

Introspecitve Performance.prereqs: Perform (any) 3 ranks, bardic performance or raging song class feature
description: Introspecitve Performance
Source ~`Legacy of the First World pg. 23`~
With no other allies to enjoy your performance, you improvise to make it more inspiring for yourself.
***Prerequisites:*** Perform (any) 3 ranks, bardic performance or raging song class feature.

***Benefit:*** Whenever you are the only creature affected by a bardic performance or raging song that normally affects all allies within a range, any bonuses granted by your bardic performance or raging song are calculated as though your class level were 4 higher. This feat does not allow you to activate a bardic performance or raging song if your actual class level is not high enough to use that performance.
Introspecitve Performance.shortDescription: Increase your effective level when you are the only creature benefiting from a performance

Intrusive Presence.prereqs: Int or Cha 21, Hidden Presence, Manipulative Presence, ability to cast possession or greater possession
description: Intrusive Presence
Source ~`Occult Adventures pg. 135`~
You can rifle through the thoughts and memories of your host.
***Prerequisites:*** Int or Cha 21, ~`Hidden Presence`~, ~`Manipulative Presence`~, ability to cast possession or greater possession.

***Benefit:*** You can use detect thoughts at will as a spell-like ability against a host creature you possess. The host receives no saving throw, and the effect functions as if you had concentrated for 3 rounds. You can also use seek thoughts on your host as a spell-like ability once during the possession. The host can attempt a Will save with a DC equal to the DC of the original possession effect. If the host succeeds, the effect fails and the host become aware of the possession if it wasn't already.
Intrusive Presence.shortDescription: Read the mind of a possessed creature

description: Inured to Draconic Majesty
Source ~`Heroes of the High Court pg. 19`~
You have spent enough time around dragons to believe that much of their fearsomeness is bluster.
***Prerequisites:*** Favored enemy (dragon) or Knowledge (arcana) 1 rank.

***Benefit:*** You gain a +4 bonus on saving throws against extraordinary or supernatural fear effects (such as a dragon's frightful presence). If a failed saving throw against an extraordinary or supernatural fear effect would make you frightened, you are instead shaken; and if a failed saving throw would make you panicked, you are instead frightened.
Inured to Draconic Majesty.shortDescription: Gain a +4 bonus to saves against fear effects

description: Invested Magic
Source ~`Pathfinder #30: The Twice-Damned Prince pg. 69`~
Spells cast using this feat pay the wages of Mammon and
forgo their more mundane costs.

***Benefit:*** You may satisfy the material requirement of any spell you cast with valuable coins, gems, or jewelry rather than the normal component. For spells with material components with no listed value, valuables worth 5 times the spell's level in gp may be expended instead of the usual components (5 gp for a 1st-level spell, 20 gp for a 4th-level spell, etc). In the case of spells with components that have a listed cost, you may expend valuables worth a number of gp equal to one and a half times this cost (thus, a spell like ~`commune`~ with material components costing 500 gp could be cast using valuables worth 750 gp). Only coins, gems, jewelry, and other similar objects of obvious worth can be used to replace other material components using this feat. The value of these objects need not match the required cost exactly, but they cannot be less than the required costs. Should valuables of greater value than required be expended (likely when employing objects like gems or jewelry), the extraneous gp value is lost, consumed with the rest of the object. The only exception comes in the case of spells with material components that have a listed worth. When casting such spells you may expend double the components' gp worth in valuables to cast the spell as if your caster level were 1 level higher. This e!ect only applies to spells with components with a specific gp value. Any expenditure beyond double the gp value grants no additional benefit.
Invested Magic.shortDescription: Use gold or gems instead of normal spell material components

Invoke Primal Instinct.prereqs: Bluff 1 rank, wild shape class feature, gnome
Invoke Primal Instinct.shortDescription: Pantomine animal behavior to frighten your enemies or make them consider you harmless

Iomedaean Sword Oath.prereqs: Prof. in longsword, Weapon Focus (longsword), BAB +4, worships Iomedae
description: Iomedaean Sword Oath
Source ~`Pathfinder #26: The Sixfold Trial pg. 72`~
By swearing to never use a weapon other than a longsword, you can achieve things normally limited to the most highly trained swordsmen.
***Prerequisites:*** Proficient in longsword, ~`Weapon Focus (longsword)`~, base attack bonus +4, worshiper of Iomedae.
***Benefit:*** You may select longsword-related feats as if you were a 4th-level fighter. For example, you may select Weapon Specialization (longsword) as a feat.

***Special:*** If you ever use a melee or ranged weapon other than a longsword in combat, you lose the benefits of this feat until you receive an atonement spell. You may still use spells that act as weapons (such as flame blade and spiritual weapon) without affecting your oath.

Ioun Resonance.shortDescription: Increase the bonus gained from an ioun stone in your possession

Ironbound Master.shortDescription: Gain armor training as a fighter

description: Ironclad Logic
Source ~`Ultimate Intrigue pg. 85`~
You appeal to sound reasoning and fact, rather than to emotion, when attempting to sway others.
***Prerequisites:*** Int 19, Diplomacy 3 ranks.

***Benefit:*** You gain a +4 bonus on Diplomacy checks whenever you add your Charisma modifier on those checks. If you have at least 10 ranks in Diplomacy and an Intelligence score of 27 or more, this bonus increases to +8. This bonus doesn't stack with the bonus from Skill Focus (Diplomacy), but this feat counts as Skill Focus (Diplomacy) for the purpose of feats and other elements with Skill Focus (Diplomacy) as a prerequisite. In verbal duels, when using tactics to which you assigned an Intelligence-based skill, you can add your Intelligence modifier instead of your Charisma modifier to the associated skill check.
Ironclad Logic.shortDescription: Gain a +4 bonus on Diplomacy checks and use Intelligence in verbal duels

Ironclad Reactions.prereqs: Base attack bonus +6 or fighter level 4th, armor training class feature, proficiency with medium armor.
Ironclad Reactions.shortDescription: Take a bonus 5-foot step when struck in combat

Ironguts.shortDescription: +2 on saves against nausea, sickening, and ingested poisons

description: Ironhide
Source ~`Advanced Player's Guide pg. 164`~
Your skin is thicker and more resilient than that of most of your people.
***Prerequisites:*** Con 13; dwarf, half-orc, or orc.
***Benefit:*** You gain a +1 natural armor bonus due to your unusually tough hide.

Irrisen Icemage.prereqs: Sorcerer, Irrisen affinity, may only be taken at first level
Irrisen Icemage.shortDescription: Cast cold spells at higher levels, change normal spells to cold

Jabbing Dancer.prereqs: Dodge, Improved Unarmed Strike, Jabbing Style, Mobility; base attack bonus +9, brawler level 5th, or monk level 5th
Jabbing Dancer.shortDescription: Move 5 feet without provoking attacks of opportunity whenever you hit with an unarmed strike

Jabbing Master.prereqs: Dodge, Improved Unarmed Strike, Jabbing Dancer, Jabbing Style, Mobility, Power Attack; base attack bonus +12, brawler level 8th, or monk level 8th
Jabbing Master.shortDescription: Increase the damage dealt with Jabbing Style

Jabbing Style.prereqs: Improved Unarmed Strike; base attack bonus +6, brawler's flurry class feature, or flurry of blows class feature
Jabbing Style.shortDescription: Gain bonus damage when two or more unarmed strikes hit the same opponent during your turn

Jackal Blood.shortDescription: +4 save vs. sleep effects, +2 Listen checks

Jackal Heritage.prereqs: Humanoid, must be taken at 1st level
Jackal Heritage.shortDescription: Gain a bonus on saves against mind-affecting effects and a bonus to Perception checks

Jaguar Pounce.shortDescription: Gain benefits of Improved Critical feat when charging or Spring Attacking a flat-footed or helpless foe

Janni Rush.prereqs: Improved Unarmed Strike, Janni Style, Janni Tempest, Acrobatics 8 ranks, Perform (dance) 8 ranks
Janni Rush.shortDescription: Always count as having a running start for jumping, and deal double damage on a jumping charge

Janni Style.prereqs: Improved Unarmed Strike, Acrobatics 3 ranks, Perform (dance) 3 ranks
Janni Style.shortDescription: Take only a -1 AC penalty when charging, flanking opponents only gain +1 attack bonus against you

Janni Tempest.prereqs: Improved Unarmed Strike, Janni Style, Acrobatics 5 ranks, Perform (dance) 5 ranks
Janni Tempest.shortDescription: After successful unarmed attack, gain +4 on combat maneuver checks to bull rush or trip

Jawbreaker.prereqs: Improved Unarmed Strike, Stunning Fist, Heal 6 ranks
Jawbreaker.shortDescription: With successful Stunning Fist, you may cripple opponent's mouth

Jinx Alchemy.prereqs: Swift alchemy class feature, Halfling Jinx trait
description: Jinx Alchemy
Source ~`Halflings of Golarion pg. 27`~
With your knowledge of alchemy, creatures you jinx cannot benefit from most sorts of alchemical compounds.
***Prerequisites:*** Swift alchemy class feature, Halfling Jinx trait.

***Benefit:*** A jinxed creature cannot benefit from the effects of potions, elixirs, or any other substance that he must ingest in order to activate. This includes alchemical substances such as antitoxin, but not extracts, mutagens, or other alchemist class abilities that only affect the alchemist. A jinxed creature still takes any penalties and detrimental effects from ingested compounds or poisons.
Jinx Alchemy.shortDescription: Prevent jinxed creatures from benefiting from potions and other alchemical substances

Jinxed Spell.prereqs: Any two metamagic feats, Halfling Jinx trait
description: Jinxed Spell (Metamagic)
Source ~`Halflings of Golarion pg. 27`~
You can make a creature that fails its spell save suffer your jinx as well.
***Prerequisites:*** Any two metamagic feats, Halfling Jinx trait.

***Benefit:*** Any creature that fails its saving throw against a jinxed spell also suffers the effects of your jinx. This feat has no effect on spells that do not allow a saving throw. If the spell affects an area or multiple creatures, you must select one creature to take the jinx, unless you have the Area Jinx feat; if you have the Area Jinx feat, choose a jinx burst area within the spell's area or among its targets and apply the jinx to those in the burst that failed their save. A jinxed spell uses up a spell slot one level higher than the spell's actual level.

Joined Wings.prereqs: Fervor or lay on hands class feature
Joined Wings.shortDescription: Use fervor or lay on hands on allies as a swift action

Joyless Toil.prereqs: Dex 13, Wis 13, Improved Unarmed Strike, base attack bonus +8
Joyless Toil.shortDescription: Nauseate a creature that you strike

description: Judgment Surge
Source ~`Ultimate Magic pg. 153`~
Once per day, the power of your faith surges, further empowering your judgments.
***Prerequisites:*** Judgment class feature.

***Benefit:*** Once per day, you can treat your class level for your judgment class feature as if it were 3 higher than normal. If you have multiple judgments active at the same time, this benefit applies to all of them.
Judgment Surge.shortDescription: Gain improved versions of your judgments
